course_info.Course Title: PWM-Security: Security Risk Analysis (Assess and Address Security Risks)
Learning Outcomes: LO1: Apply basic risk identification techniques to detect tell-tale signs and symptoms of potential security threats.
LO2: Follow organizational procedures to identify risks by recognizing surveillance, inappropriate behavior, or potential threats.
LO3: Analyze situations and relate them to prior experiences to identify suspicious activities, attire, or explosive devices.
LO4: Collaborate with security teams to assess risks using established methods of risk analysis.
course_info.TSC Title: Security Risk Analysis Assess and Address Security Risks

analyst_responses.What are the performance gaps in the ind: Many security personnel find it challenging to accurately assess the potential impact of security deficiencies. A failure to accurately gauge the severity and scope of these gaps can lead to misprioritization of resources and inadequate responses to critical vulnerabilities, ultimately undermining the effectiveness of security efforts.
analyst_responses.Why do you think this WSQ course will ad: The course trains security teams to collaborate and use methods of risk analysis, this improves their ability to make well informed recommendations. Professionals will learn how to assess the situation and identify risks, this ensures resources are allocated where they are most needed, significantly strengthening overall protection.
